ml.alternet.parser

Class Grammar.Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.alternet.parser.Grammar.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Presentable, TraversableRule
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Grammar.Combine, Grammar.Token, Grammar.Wrapper
    Enclosing interface:
    Grammar

    public abstract static class Grammar.Rule
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Presentable, TraversableRule
    A grammar is composed of rules that can be tokens or so-called rules. When parsing, a rule yield a EventsHandler.RuleStart event and a EventsHandler.RuleEnd event.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard
    See Also:
    Grammar.Token

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface ml.alternet.parser.util.TraversableRule

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()
        When a grammar declares a rule or token, it has a name which is the name of the field in that grammar, otherwise it is an anonymous rule or token.
        Returns:
        The proper name of the rule/token, or a name based on the class name.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Used internally to set the name of this rule.
        Parameters:
        name - The grammar field name.

      • isGrammarField

        public boolean isGrammarField()
        Description copied from interface: TraversableRule
        Indicates whether this rule is defined as a field in a grammar.
        Specified by:
        isGrammarField in interface TraversableRule
        Returns:
        true if this rule has a name false otherwise.

      • isFragment

        public boolean isFragment()
        Indicates whether this rule was annotated with Grammar.Fragment or not, and therefore have to be processed by its nested rule.
        Returns:
        true if this rule/token is a fragment, false otherwise.

      • setFragment

        public void setFragment(boolean isFragment)
        Used internally to set whether this rule is a fragment (annotated with Grammar.Fragment).
        Parameters:
        isFragment - true if this rule/token is a fragment, false otherwise.

      • toStringBuilder

        public StringBuilder toStringBuilder(StringBuilder buffer)
        Append to the given buffer a representation of the rule, that will be its name if it has one, or the pretty representation of this rule.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer that receive the string representation.
        Returns:
        The same buffer, for chaining.
